interface.name: ICharacter
interface.description: This interface is in charge of naming the functions that are specific to the character object.

interface.name: IView
interface.description: This interface is in charge of naming the functions that are specific to the views.

interface.name: IController
interface.description: This interface is in charge of naming the functions that are specific to the controllers.

interface.name: IHistory
interface.description: This interface is in charge of naming the functions that are specific to the history logic.

interface.name: IDBAdapter
interface.description: This interface is in charge of naming the functions that are specific to the adapters.

interface.name: IGame
interface.description: This interface is in charge of naming the functions that are specific to the game logic.

interface.name: ICharacterFactory
interface.description: This interface is in charge of naming the functions that are specific to the character factory object.

class.name: MySQLiMAdapter
class.description: The MySQLiMAdapter class is based on the design pattern called adapter. Which consists in generating an intermediary that facilitates the processes with the current application with respect to another imported file.

class.name: Rogue
class.description: The rogue class is in charge of creating an object with all the information referring to the rogue entity as well as defining attributes, calculations, and statistics specific to the class.

class.name: Character
class.description: The character class is in charge of defining all the attributes that belong to all the characters in general.

class.name: View
class.description: The view class is in charge of defining the minimum methods that every view must have in order to be shown properly in the interface.

class.name: History
class.description: The history class is in charge of creating an object of the history entity with all its respective attributes, and its main objective is to keep the history of the fights between characters.

class.name: Mage
class.description: The mage class is in charge of creating an object with all the information referring to the mage entity as well as defining attributes, calculations, and statistics specific to the class.

class.name: Game
class.description: It's the class in charge of managing the logic of the game.

class.name: Controller
class.description: The controller class defines the constructor and the general minimum methods that every controller should have.

class.name: Warrior
class.description: The warrior class is in charge of creating an object with all the information referring to the warrior entity as well as defining attributes, calculations, and statistics specific to the class.

class.name: Index_controller
class.description: The index_controller is in charge of handling views in the interface by using the rendering of the View class. It is also in charge of creating the variables to display the necessary information within the views, usually using business logic to do so.
